name: Butterfly Bush
climate: Butterfly Bush thrives best in a temperate climate where winters are not too harsh.
It can tolerate a variety of climates, including subtropical and maritime conditions.
The plant is quite adaptable to different climates, but prefers areas with warm summers.
In cooler climates, it may need some protection from frost and cold winds.
sunlight: Butterfly Bush requires full sun to bloom to its fullest potential, with at least six hours daily.
While it can tolerate partial shade, too much shade results in fewer flowers and leggy growth.
Near a window or open area where it can receive plenty of bright, direct sunlight is ideal.
The more sunlight Butterfly Bush gets, the more vibrant its flowers and healthier the plant.
watering: Newly planted bushes need regular watering to establish a strong root system.
Once established, it is drought-tolerant but appreciates occasional deep watering.
Avoid overwatering, especially in poorly drained soils, to prevent root rot.
Watering in the morning is recommended so leaves can dry during the day, reducing disease risk.
soil: Butterfly Bush prefers well-drained soil rich in organic matter and nutrients.
It can tolerate poor soil conditions, but will flourish in amended and fertile soil.
The plant does best in slightly acidic to neutral soil pH for optimal growth.
Loamy soil that provides good drainage is ideal for supporting root health and flowering.
